articles.title: Research Methods and Skills
articles.description: Data manipulation, research methods, and statistics in Psychology
articles.contents:
This is the homepage for the R-based sections of the University of Lincoln’s MSc programmes in Developmental Psychology, Research Methods in Psychology, and Forensic Psychology.
Semester A - PSY9251M/PSY9219M
Research Methods in Psychology/Research Methods and Skills
Module co-ordinator: Tochukwu Onwuegbusi
Staff:
Tochukwu Onwuegbusi
Charlotte Cartledge
Ava Horowitz
Patrick Hylton
Semester B - PSY9250M/PSY9003
Advanced Research Methods in Psychology/Advanced Research Methods and Skills
Module co-ordinator: Peter Clark
Staff:
Sarah Sauve
Tochukwu Onwuegbusi
Michael Mireku
Getting set up for the course
For both Semester A and Semester B modules, we expect you to download and install R and RStudio. You will need the following:
A recent version of R, download from here.
A recent version of RStudio, download from here
You’ll find a fantastic video guide to installing R and RStudio by Danielle Navarro over on YouTube
Another possibility is RStudio.cloud, a web-based version of RStudio accessible from anywhere using a web-browser such as Chrome. For many parts of the course, the 25 hours free monthly access will be sufficient. However, you may find that during assessment times this isn’t adequate for your needs.
